intro: Stenotus scaber, commonly known as the rough stenotus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Stenotus scaber is often found in wetlands and along streams, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
